name: subclassify
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to divide a group of things or people into smaller groups according to their type, or to say which smaller group something or someone belongs to: be subclassified into The patients were subclassified into four groups.be subclassified as Risk factors were further sub-classified as domestic or outside the household.
More examplesFewer examplesEach of these was further sub-classified according to their genetic, environmental, and management influences.Within these categories, funds may be subclassified by investment objective, investment approach, or specific focus. We were unable to subclassify the type of injury in this study.
